review.comment_positive: The spa exceeded my expectations. 2 hours massage + 50 min salt scrub. They have a promo so it's really great value for money. Loved the aroma sea salt scrub - they use coarse salt and my skin feels so smooth even 1 week later. Staff were helpful as well. Bicycles are free for hotel guests to use so one can cycle around the ancient town area though navigating the roads is quite challenging during peak hours. Room is reasonably clean and neat. Laundry service was by load and very reasonably priced.
review.comment_negative: The hot water was fluctuating between very hot and cold but minor issue, just shower quicker. Bath tub is above average height so it takes quite a bit of effort to climb out safely as the tiles are quite smooth and there was no appropriate grab rails.

review.comment_positive:
Convenient and room had a nice design with a decently good view

Affordable
review.comment_negative:
We were given a room at level 7, highest level just below pool - lift access was only to level 6 and we needed to use a staircase to go up

Only one lift in the property, and we had to wait for very long at peak periods to go up or down

At level 7, water pressure was low and inconsistent. Especially for the hot water, it came and went inconsistently 

Below average gym, windowless and stuffy in basement, with very old equipment

Breakfast - below average, options very limited, some items appeared stale, and soaking in oil, a lot of mosquitoes and flies when we were there

Bike - free bikes were good, but most of them had some problems, whether it was a missing bell, non functional brakes, or damaged locking mechanisms

review.comment_positive:
Very nice hotel. My room was spacious, had a balcony and was really quiet. Very good breakfast. I absolutely LOVED the rooftop pool. It was so nice to chill there in the evening after a full day sightseeing. And the view was so beautiful! 
Staff is very friendly and helpful. I also had a massage and treatment at the SPA and it was very good too. 
The hotel is about 10 min walk from the centre but that was a good thing, as it's away from the noise. I'm a female solo traveller and I always felt really safe walking around (there are many hotels and shops in the area).

review.comment_positive: The whole hotel including the rooms is very tastefully decorated. The room was spacious, with a very good bed and quiet in the night. Breakfast is high quality and you have broad choice of Vietnamese and Western style dishes including delicious soup of the day and eggs/omelette station. The staff is very friendly, helpful and competent, especially Ms. Vii. They recommended a lot of activities in and around Hoi An and also arranged them and even bargained with the local partners. The hotel is around 5-10 min walking distance from the old town city center, this ensures also that it is very quite at night. You have free hotel bicycles available.

review.comment_positive: We had a wonderful stay in Hoi An; our hotel was a big part of this positive experience. The team made us feel at home with welcome drinks and provided excellent recommendations for tailors and sightseeing activities. Because the city can be very touristy at times, the staff briefed us about tourist traps that needed to be avoided. The hotel is a 10-minute walk from the city's center, which makes the area pleasant and quiet. The breakfast was delicious and diverse, and we enjoyed lounging by the pool after a long day of sightseeing.

review.rating: Perfect stay! We will be back!
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
We absolutely loved our stay at Cozy Savvy! We arrived expecting to be put up in a room within the hotel but to our surprise, we had booked a villa room 20 seconds away which really did feel like our own private flat rather than a room! It isn't located within the main hotel but a very short walk away - not a problem for us as the room was gorgeous! Beautifully decorated and very spacious, with the pool just around the corner - we couldn't have asked for anything more.

The breakfast selection was huge - lots of savoury and sweet options with plenty of Vietnamese options, perfect if you want to try some local dishes. All delicious.

Before booking I read some reviews about the location. Yes you do have to walk about 10 mins to reach the old town but that shouldn't be seen as a negative. The short walk is a joy, a great opportunity to see the real Hoi An away from the tourist bustle. And Hoi An isn't just the old town, there is so much more to see.

If you do anything, make the most of the hotel's free bike hire, this totally transformed our trip for us! And this is when you benefit from being slightly away from the old town (especially if you're not a confident cyclist). The location of the hotel meant we had easier access to Kim Bong Carpentry Village, An Bang Beach and Thanh Ha Pottery Village. The countryside is so beautiful and a must see.

Overall, we loved our stay at Cozy Savvy and Hoi An. We will definitely be back in the future!

review.comment_positive: My wife and I traveled to Hoi An in June 2022 shortly after the country opened after the pandemic. This hotel was a great place to stay during our quick trip. The location was great and it was easy to walk to the old quarter. The hotel also had bikes you could borrow to get places further away. We were grateful for this so we could get to An Bang Beach, which is beautiful! The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable with a nice pool. Our room was spacious and very clean. The breakfast served in the restaurant was really tasty as well. The staff was super friendly and very sweet as well.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and laid back place to stay in Hoi An.

review.comment_positive:
From the moment we arrived till the time we left, everything was excellent. The rooms were very spacious and clean, the breakfast selection was wide and good, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. Kudos to the hotel for having a team of exceptional staff who were always one step ahead of every need. A shoutout to Lyn and Cathy, you both made our stay superb. Lyn was the first person who met us when we arrived. Her warm personality and attention to detail left a very good first impression and was a foretaste of the kind of level of service that was to come throughout our stay. It was a joy meeting her whenever we went out and came back. She also gave us a lot of useful information and recommendations and every single one was really good. Cathy, your Mandarin is good and we enjoyed conversing with you in the language. Thank you for your excellent service and also for the totally unexpected service recovery when you got to know of a tiny, and I really mean insignificant, hiccup on the last day of our stay. We will definitely recommend your hotel to anyone who is visiting Hoi An.

The location of the hotel is near to the Old Town especially if you cycle, which we did every day using the bikes provided by the hotel. The bikes were so useful as they got us to our destinations quickly in the sweltering heat.

review.rating: The Cozy Boutique Hotel is a rare gem. Clean, good service and very family friendly.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia ÄÃ¬nh Cozy Deluxe
review.comment_positive:
The hotel was opened in 2019. The facilities were new and clean when we visited. We booked the family connecting rooms. They looked exactly like the photos on Booking.com. Service was excellent. Special mention goes to guest service officers Tam and Lyn and our porter. 

Tips: 
- The hotel restaurant was not fully opened due to limited visitors as of June 2022. However, a chef is available. Breakfast sets (local and Western options) are available for about USD5 at the hotel restaurant. Lunch and dinner can be ordered. For example, their fish and chips was delicious, substansial and inexpensive for my son who needed some familiar foods for comfort.  
- There's a beautiful, Instagramable cafe 2 mins walk from the hotel. Head there for coffee and quiet work. The cafe also calms down grumpy teenagers. :)
review.comment_negative: None! For families travelling with young children or the elderly, consider bringing slippers to wear in bathrooms. Like most Vietnamese hotels, bathroom floors are super clean but slippery by Western standards.

It's an easy walk to Ancient Town, in a relatively quiet little section of town but still several restaurants, cafe and things very close. For in-room comfort, wifi and aircon are great (important for those steamy Hoi An days). Really appreciated the daily water bottle top-up. Highlight was definitely the staff who genuinely care about you having a nice stay and enjoying your experience in Hoi An.

review.rating: A small boutique hotel with an exceptional personal touch.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia ÄÃ¬nh Cozy Deluxe
review.comment_positive:
The hotel was very good, and the staff made it excellent. If you are looking for a small boutique hotel with a personal touch, then I would highly recommend the Cozy Savvy. Cindy, in particular, looked after us from the moment we arrived, and we felt like she really cared about making our stay enjoyable. The hotel is about 10 mins from the old town and is at the end of a long road right before the main river area. For us, this was great as it was close enough to walk into the old town, but far enough away to be quiet and peaceful (apart from the ubiquitous cockerels). 
Breakfast was lovely  the pool was great and we had a fantastic stay.
review.comment_negative: The street outside was a bit noisy at night over the weekend, and Hoi An itself is absolutely heaving on Saturday and Sunday. You also have to get used to the early morning cockerel (but don't let that put you off).

review.comment_positive: We loved our stay here at Cozy Savy Boutique, everything from the staff to the buffet breakfast, could not be faulted. The location is a short, 5-10 minute walk from Hoi An old town however, the hotel provides free use of bicycles for getting around. The staff were amazing, extremely kind and helpful with great English, meaning they were able to help with anything you needed. Buffet breakfast was great with a large selection of food, including eggs, fresh fruit, juice, cereal, baked goods, home made jam and Asian options as well. The rooftop pool was great to spend time relaxing and cooling off from the hot, midday sun. We really enjoyed our time here land look forward to returning.

review.comment_positive: We really enjoyed our stay at Cozy Hotel. We spent five nights here, and it was amazing. Originally, we had booked a hotel in Danang, but we changed it quite last minute, and it turned out to be a really good decision. Hoi An is a lovely and cozy city that has a lot to offer, including day trips to other places. We especially loved the rooftop swimming pool; it was a fantastic place to relax after a long day. Everyone in the hotel was super friendly and helpful. We received plenty of recommendations for trips and things to see. The breakfast was great. The hotel's location is also very good; it is situated in a calm area, but you can easily walk to the center. We also appreciated the bike rental service.

This is our first visit to Vietnam, and we are happy that we chose to stay in Cozy Savvy during our time in Hoi An. The hotel is cute with good facilities and only a short walking distance to the Old Town. Our room is clean and very comfortable. My husband had a cold on our second day here. The accessibility of Netflix, YouTube, etc, on the TV made me very happy to stay in our room!
Great shout out to the three lovely receptionists we met so far at the front desk: Joy, Daisy and Cindy. They made us feel welcome the minute we arrived at the hotel. They are so friendly and delightful for a chat and sharing their culture. We appreciate their insightful recommendations for local attractions/food and suggestions regarding our daily plans.
Overall, we have had an enjoyable experience during our stay here!

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive: This place had to be the absolute number one place during my stay in Vietnam. The views were great, the staff went far far far beyond expectation, the room was amazing, the tub was beautiful, the breakfast amazing, one of the best spa experiences we received as well. This place literally has it all. It was my girlfriend's birthday and I chose this place because of its fantastic reviews and it didn't disappoint. My partner went to the spa and said it was "life-changing." They allowed us to check in a little early, I prepared a birthday surprise for her and the staff knew, gave her all special treatment in the spa and even got us a beautiful cake just for her. No extra cost, they just went the extra mile. Any request was fulfilled beyond what was required and always asked if there was anything else, and to never hesitate to talk with them. The room was beautiful, but the shining beauty was definitely the bath tub. It was gorgeous and was a perfect way to end a birthday with relaxation. I cannot express how grateful and astonished by how wonderful Cozy Savvy was. When I return to Hoi An, I will not even look for another place to stay.

review.comment_negative: Although we had actually booked a room in the cozy Savvy Hotel, we were accommodated in the "Villa" hotel next door. Both are marketed separately and but are apparently also connected via booking.com, although the Villa is much cheaper when booked directly. Accordingly, there was an unpleasant feeling of being misled for a short time. However, the staff organised a change to the other hotel, so we were satisfied in the end. However, I consider the practice of interconnected hotel bookings problematic.

We werenâ€™t aware that there were two different separate buildings and we stayed in the â€œbackâ€ building. The rooms appear to be exactly the same (layout and decor), and if anything, the second building seemed to offer more privacy and solitude. Vi was very helpful at check in taking the time to share a map of the area and share recommendations.
review.comment_negative: No elevator in the second building but the staff carried our bags at check in and check out which we appreciated. The bed sheets are a little pilly and rough against your skin. The pools werenâ€™t very clean (sticks, bugs and a used cigarette floating around) and the water temp was a little too warm.

review.rating: The service here was amazing, we love it!
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
The hotel's proximity to the old town made it convenient for us, either through a short walk or a very affordable taxi ride.

- The rooftop pool was a standout, providing a relaxing and enjoyable retreat.

- The staff, particularly Daisy, Lyn, and the front desk team, played a pivotal role in making our stay memorable. Their genuine hospitality, personalised service, and valuable recommendations truly set them apart.

- The service at Cozy Savvy was unparalleled, standing out as the best among all our stays in Vietnam.

- The bedrooms were impressive, featuring comfortable mattresses, spacious layouts, and fantastic bathrooms.

- Breakfast, while having room for improvement, offered a good selection to start the day.

- The rooftop pool was a highlight, even though we didn't use the gym due to its small size.

Cozy Savvy Boutique Hotel Hoi An exceeded our expectations, and we would unquestionably choose to stay here again, whether with a partner or family. A heartfelt thank you to the exceptional staff for making our stay truly memorable.
review.comment_negative: - The spa, while not the absolute best, provided a decent experience, although staff attire could be improved for a more spa-like ambiance.

review.rating: Amazing staff and a large, clean, comfortable room. Recommend to all!
review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
Every single member of staff was warm, friendly and helpful. 
The rooms were clean and the bed, bedding and pillows were really comfortable. It was a large room so we could fit 2 cots (provided by the hotel) with still enough room for the girls to crawl around and play in! The walls were thick and we didnâ€™t hear any noise from other rooms (although the real test would be to ask the people next to us!). Great, thick curtains that blocked out all the light, making nap time a breeze! Powerful air con.
The shower was powerful and the bath was amazing - easy to get it hot enough.
The breakfast was vast and varied.
It was a short walk to the old town/night market.
Great, big umbrellas for those rainy days.

We didnâ€™t use it - but the rooftop bar looked incredible. And the bikes would have been amazing!

We came away with our 10 month old twins and the staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful; from giving us directions and booking taxis, to entertaining them and asking about them when they had a fever. Our girls are very messy eaters (self weaning) but we were never made to feel unwelcome or a pain - despite the mess we created. We would certainly return to Cozy Savvy and recommend to all friends, either with family, friends or a couple.

Thank you so much

review.rating: Amazing hotel! Incredible staff, Great location, great facilities and lovely and clean. Everything you need and more for
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Me and my Mum visited in May and cannot recommend this hotel more! 
Amazing staff, great location, lovely breakfast, great facilities and everything you need for such a perfect stay in Hoi Ann. 
The staff really do go above and beyond!! They cannot help you enough and it really made our trip. Special thank you to Lyn and Vi for always being so lovely and helpful. 
The hotel is a very short walk in to the main town and the walk is very safe. The breakfast offers both Western and Vietnamese with plenty of choice! The gym is basic but more than enough equipment. The pool area is lovely with a nice chilled atmosphere. We borrowed bikes twice which were free and a great addition. The rooms and hotel itself was so clean! 
Would 100% come back and recommend this to anyone wanted a great hotel in Hoi An! 
It really made our stayâ€¦.Thank you â˜ºï¸

review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng
review.comment_positive: This place is incredible. Really comfortable, well furnished and spacious enough room. Ours had a lovely view over the water. Impeccably clean. The breakfasts were my favourite from all the hotels on our trip so far. The highlight is definitely the staff. Vy (not sure if I have the spelling right) and Hanna were the standouts, they went out of their way to ask about our stay and give very personalized tips while here. But really all the staff went above and beyond for us. The hotel is a short walk (or even shorter bike ride) into the old town. I really felt at home here.
review.comment_negative: The only issue we had was with the bikes. My partner is 6 feet tall and none of the bikes were quite big enough for him.

The Spa is excellent, a real spa atmosphere. 
The staff is very kind and professional.

I wanted to extend my booking of 2 nights but the hotel was fully booked for one of the date.
I could still stay one more night and i asked to receive the same room rate but they wanted to charge more because it was a different room.
So I had to leave and find another hotel.

The gym is really really basic. Only one bike and one run machine and weights. Enough for training but small.

review.comment_positive:
This hotel was incredible. The staff was friendly and helpful even before we arrived through our email correspondence. They were able to accept a package I had delivered there, which was easily handled.

When we first arrived, Lynn helped me and my fellow travelers out as we got our welcome drink. She spent a lot of time with us helping to design our entire stay. She pointed out several coffee, lunch, & dinner spots. She helped us out with a reservation overlooking the water at one of the higher demand restaurants. She also suggested a few tailor shops (because that was a major priority for me in Hoi An!). She also said that if we had any suggestions at the end of the stay (things that didnâ€™t work out or great new finds), to let the Cozy Savvy Staff know so that they can share the info with future guests. 

The hotel was the perfect distance away from the hustle bustle of the old town. Iâ€™m definitely staying here again when I come back to Hoi An!

review.comment_positive: We had an amazing one night stay at Cozy Savvy Boutique Hotel. Our room was beautiful and very clean, the bed and pillows were so comfortable and the shower was amazing! review.comment_positive: The hotel is located a little out of the Old Town so it's quiet and nice. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms have beautiful brass fittings and lovely bath tubs. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Old Town and there are bicycles available for guests too. There are mini marts and restaurants near the hotel so it's very convenient. The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. They speak good English and are always willing to answer any questions from guests. We booked the coconut bamboo boat ride with them and it was excellent! We also did a massage at their spa. The service was good and the rooms were clean. Highly recommend this hotel!

review.rating: Lovely stay in a great hotel
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Cosy is the name and and an excellent  description of the hotel as well. We have travelled Asia and Malaysia for about 6 months and this has been the best hotel we have stayed in. 
The staff have been excellent, many of them address us personally and they were attentive to any requests such as we asked for black tea bags being British instead of the green tea and they quickly changed it for us and also remembered each day that it was our preference. 
Nothing felt like too much trouble for them. The rooms were well appointed and clean, I am particular about cleanliness. 
Great location just a few streets away from the centre so far enough not to be bothered by any early early morning bar noise but very close too. 
We borrowed the hotel bikes most days so we could take a ride into town and we went to the beach one day which is further out , weâ€™re not fit but the ride is pretty much flat there and back so perfect really. 
I shall be hopeful that the hotels on our forward journey are as good as this. Also the breakfast choice was the best weâ€™ve had so far as well. 
Thank you Daisy & Anne ğŸ˜

Lovely hotel with comfortable room and bed. 
Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Breakfast buffet was delicious, especially loved the banana pancakes!
Location was great, just outside of ancient town so that you donâ€™t hear the noise of the hustle and bustle, whilst still being close enough to easily walk everywhere.
We loved being able to use the hotel bikes for free, was wonderful to ride around Hoi An and nearby locations.
We also absolutely loved the rooftop pool, absolutely gorgeous view! It was great to be able to order food and cocktails up to the pool so that we could lounge around and enjoy an afternoon drink.
review.comment_negative:
Noise from floors above and below is easily heard through the door, which made it difficult to sleep at times. I could easily hear people talking at night two floor below, just because of the way the design of the building is and how close our bed was to our door. If youâ€™re a light sleeper I would highly recommend earplugs or a sound machine.
Shower door doesnâ€™t have proper sealing, so water runs out and onto the floor. Easy to clean up, but got a bit annoying after a few days of mopping up the water after each shower

review.rating: 3 stars at best. Definitely not a five star hotel.
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cozy Savvy - Morning Glory
review.comment_positive: Absolutely loved Hoi An, but there wasn't much I liked about this hotel at all. The positive is it was a 10-15 minute walk to the main part of town, which is fine because it's safe to walk at night. Lots of local spa places on the street which were good. Also there's a little store behind the hotel with a really lovely Vietnamese lady that runs it if you need anything.
review.comment_negative:
I've stayed at plenty of five star hotels, including others in Vietnam and this is absolutely far from it. 
- The check in experience was poor. I checked in after 9pm so she said she wouldn't show me the amenities and I had to figure it out myself - never checked into a five 5 star hotel that was this apathetic to a guest.
- This hotel has two buildings which I wasn't told of, and my room was in a different building down an alley. At night there's a random guy sleeping in the hallway on a trundle bed. (again, not a five star experience and felt very unsafe) 
- My room was on the ground floor which I wasn't told when booking. There's no real door, just a sliding door with a key that's difficult to use. There's a few stairs as well which are not easy when you have a suitcase. 
- Bathroom was old and mouldy (see photos)
- I asked for a late check in and they wanted to charge me 500,000VD - they ended up waiving it when I said no

review.comment_positive: Mooi hotel aan de rand van de stad Hoi An, lopend binnen 10 min in het centrum. Gratis fietsen beschikbaar, om de stad te verkennen. review.rating: Great value for money, comfortable, convenient with lovely staff. Definitely consider this hotel for your stay in hoi an
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive: We loved everything. The rooms were comfortable and spacious. The staff were fabulous - the most friendly out of any hotel we stayed at in Vietnam. Vi took care of us when we arrived, showing us plenty of places to visit and eat by annotating a map without it feeling like she was just promoting the businesses of family/friends. We did end up visiting many of the places she recommended. The pools were so lovely with a fantastic view from the rooftop pool. It was so hot while we were in Hoi An, but the room was well air conditioned. The breakfast was lovely as was the restaurant. We loved the cocktails here as well. Itâ€™s walking distance to the old town and all the main attractions, but the strip you walk down to get there also has great restaurants and cafes too.
review.comment_negative: Nothing. Everything was great.

review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive: The cozy savvy hotel was the second to last place we stayed on a 3 week trip to Vietnam and Thailand. My partner and I both agree it was our favorite accommodation weâ€™ve had so far. The staff was absolutely incredible. Daisy worked reception at our building, the cozy Villas and she treated us like family. we arranged for staff to pick us up from the airport and drop us back off at the airport, a 45 minute drive. our driver met us as soon as we stepped foot out from baggage and brought us to a car with AC and cold water bottles. when we arrived we were promptly given a map of Hanoi and the sweet front desk attendant showed us her favorite markets, beaches, restaurants coffee shops etc. our room was very clean and the cleaning service was thorough. the pool is kept very cold which was a life saver during the times of the day that were over 100 degrees. we will be coming back and staying with these wonderful folks!

review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cozy Savvy - Morning Glory
review.comment_positive: The room was spacious and the bed was comfy. The staff were extremely friendly and gave us lots of information on Hoi An when we checked in. Lots of great restaurant recommendations which we used â˜ºï¸ short stroll into the town but it was nice being away from the hustle and bustle.

review.comment_positive: The hotel is in a convenient location close to the river and the Old Town. The rooms are very comfortable and the breakfast selection is excellent. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, Cindy and Anna in particular; they gave us daily food recommendations for where to eat locally - all of which were great! review.comment_positive: This hotel is a total gem in Hoi An. The staff is amazing, attentive, hard working, and so kind (they always made a point to say hello and check-in on your stay. The decor of the room was very well done and the cleanliness was top notch. The location is perfect and a short walk or bike ride (they have free bikes  into the old town area where the charm of Hoi An truly comes to life. The are tons of great cafe's and restaurants in the area, but the hotels' restaurant was good too. We would definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough to travel to Hoi An again.

review.comment_positive:
This has been one of the best hotel stays I've had so far! Truly a gem considering the price I paid for. The staff were not only genuinely hospitable. The best part was their generosity in sharing valuable local information about tours, attractions, activities and other 'know-hows' in HoiAn. My stay was nothing but pleasant and relaxing. 

The breakfast buffet offered a wide range of dishes. I really appreciated the assortment of salads, fruits, breads, and homemade spreads. Beverages were also varied! My problem is that there's just too many choices. 

The laundry service was also impeccable. The turn around time was only a few hours and my clothes came back looking fresh and smelling clean.

review.comment_positive:
A wonderful new hotel on the outskirts of the old town.  Still walkable but we usually hailed the gold electric golf carts that run around the roads for just a few dollars.  The staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable, especially Hannah.  They were able to supply a wonderful cake for our daughter's birthday (at breakfast!)  and the small restaurant was great for a bite to eat.  Breakfasts were varied and plentiful with lots of fruit and eggs cooked to order.  The roof pool area was never crowded and just what was needed after walking around in the heat.  Everywhere was beautifully furnished and decorated.  Comfy beds and strong showers.  Massages available onsite too.  A great little coffee shop just a few doors up the street.
Interconnecting rooms make this a great family hotel, or for groups of friends.

review.comment_positive:
The very friendly staff at this beautifully appointed boutique hotel take customer service to a new level .  
Nhung  (Katie ) spoke with us every day , taking time to make sure we were comfortable  and  giving us great tips on what to see and where to eat in Hoi An . 
Other notable staff members ;Hannah helped us with information and recommendations for the best tours and cooking classes . Nothing was too much bother .  The staff even took time to follow up to check that the tours we picked met our expectations . 
Harry the driver made sure we were picked up and dropped off at the Airport on time both trips . 
The Hotel  has a good roof top pool . The rooms are well furnished and very comfortable .
The Hotel location suited us as it is an easy walk into the old town  but in a quieter street . 
The excellent buffet breakfast has a wide variety  of fresh  western and local style food . 
Highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Hoi An .

Hello, we are a couple that has gone to hoi an for 2 nights.
We would like to say that our experience has been amazing, the location of the hotel is wonderful, just 5-10 minutues to the center of hoi an. The hotel has a swimming pool in the rooftop which is very helpful when the heat is horrible, the views are nice though.

The breakfast is buffet style and is complete, there are lot of vietnamesse kind of food so we did not try much of that but you can also have normal food.

They will keep your lugggage either if you arrive earlier than check in or leave later than check out.
Our room was big enough, cozzy with a bath tub that we definetly try. Of coyrse you will have aircon.


But what made oyr stay great was the staff, we would like to special mention Lyn, who helped us to settle in and gave us any kind of information that we needed during those days. Also the guy that keep our luggage was Tam Tai, a very smily guy that was also very profesional.

Overall a fantastic experience that we recommend to anybody

review.rating: Le meilleur accueil de notre voyage
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
Nous sommes restÃ©s deux nuits avec ma compagne, et cette parenthÃ¨se dans notre voyage au Vietnam Ã©tait un bonheur.

Les chambres sont propres, spacieuses et rÃ©centes. Dans la salle de bain vous pouvez profiter d'une baignoire et d'une douche !

Au dernier Ã©tage vous pouvez profiter d'une piscine sur le toit, parfait pour le couchÃ© de soleil !! Petit plus l'hÃ´tel propose aussi un SPA et des massages. Sans doute le meilleur massage du Vietnam.

Le petit dÃ©jeuner est dÃ©licieux, je recommande les Pancakes Ã  la banane :)

Ne vous inquiÃ©tez pas pour la localisation un tout petit peu excentrÃ© car l'hÃ´tel offre des vÃ©los, vous serez dans la vielle ville en 5 min.

HonnÃªtement c'est le meilleur rapport qualitÃ© prix que nous avons eu depuis trÃ¨s longtemps !!

Enfin je termine ce commentaire pour remercier le Staff de cet Hotel, nous sommes actuellement en tour du monde et c'est de loin le meilleur accueil que nous avons eu tous pays confondus !! Ils sont gentils, rÃ©actif, vous donne un maximum d'infos dÃ¨s votre arrivÃ©e pour vous conseiller durant votre sÃ©jour, et se soucient tous les jours de votre expÃ©rience dans l'hÃ´tel.

Allez y sans hÃ©siter !!

A bientÃ´t !

review.rating: Sehr nettes Hotel in guter Lage mit etwas Verbesserungspotenzial
review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
Die Lage ist optimal. Sehr nahe zur Altstadt. Sehr netten kleines, feines Hotel.
Die Mitarbeiter sind alle extrem freundlich, hilfsbereit und aufmerksam und kÃ¶nnen super Englisch. Die Kommunikation ist so sehr einfach. Und alle sind sehr kompetent.
Das Hotel ist sehr hÃ¼bsch und liebevoll dekoriert.
Das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksbuffet ist genial.
FahrrÃ¤der kann man jederzeit nutzen und bei unserer Fahrt zum Strand haben wir auch gleich BadetÃ¼cher mitbekommen.
review.comment_negative:
Der Obstkorb, den wir am ersten Tag am Zimmer hatten, war am nÃ¤chsten Tag einfach kommentarlos verschwunden. 
Wir haben WÃ¤sche waschen lassen und die saubere WÃ¤sche wurde zum Teil lose auf einen Koffer gelegt, der natÃ¼rlich vom herumreisen schmutzig ist. Keine Ahnung, warum da frisch gewaschene WÃ¤sche drauflegt. Normalerweise bekommen wir in anderen Hotels saubere WÃ¤sche in einem sauberen Sack. Am frisch bezogenen Bett wÃ¤re es auch viel besser aufgehoben gewesen. Der andere Teil wurde in den Kasten gehÃ¤gt. Das finde ich auch nicht ok, dass man den Kasten, in den meine privaten Sachen sind, Ã¶ffnet und was umrÃ¤umt (PrivatspÃ¤re).
Die Hotelmanagerin hat uns beim ersten FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck mitten im GesprÃ¤ch angesprochen. Dabei stand sie immer links hinter mir, was total unangenehm ist. Sie hat zwar meinen Partner angesehen, aber mir stand sie quasi immer im Nacken. Das erste GesprÃ¤ch war auch sehr unangenehm, weil sie immer wieder nachgehakt hat, welche Infos wir schon von den Mitarbeitern erhalten haben und wir sollen uns doch mit ihr zusammensetzen und irgendeine Liste mit Dingen durchgehen. 
Das Hotel ist so hÃ¼bsch, schade dass nicht mehr Wert auf Wartung/Erhaltung gelegt wird. Z.B. Schmutzrand auf den Fliesen um den ganzen Pool, also oberste Fliesenreihe, die aus dem Wasser schaut. Polster am Sessel hatte Flecken. Ich habe ihn umgedreht, aber das sollte doch gesehen werden, bevor ich das Zimmer beziehe.
Ganz prominent liegt eine Preisliste auf, was was kostet, wenn man im Zimmer etwas kaputt macht. Da hat man gleich das GefÃ¼hl, dass man besser nicht angreift und nutzt, um nicht die zerbrechlichen GegenstÃ¤nde des Zimmers kaputt zu machen.
Das Licht am Balkon kann man icht selbt ein- und ausschalten. Es gibt einfach generelle Zeiten, wann es brennt.
Unser Zimmer im sechsten Stock war oft vom lauten Brummen der Poolanlage beeintrÃ¤chtigt. Fairerweise muss ich sagen, dass uns angeboten wurde, das Zimmer zu wechseln, aber dann wÃ¤re der Ausblick weg gewesen.

review.rating: An amazing hotel that in an amazing City
review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
We Spent 15 nights at this amazing hotel, all the staff are friendly and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble.
Every evening the staff would ask if we wanted a taxi, which they organised for us on 2 occasions, otherwise it was safe to take a 10-minute stroll the centre of Hoi An where all the restaurants, bars and shops were.
The roof top pool was lovely with a wonderful view of the city and river. Everyday had a happy hour between 2:30 â€“ 4:30 where the staff served amazing cocktails.
The hotel spa was very good and not expensive, we had a massage after a day trip and my wife had a manicure the day after we arrived.
A special thank you to Hannah, Kathy, Tracy and Tony who went above and beyond in ensuring our stay was an enjoyable one.
We would stay again at Cozy Savy the next time we visit Hoi An.

review.rating: Perfect place to start your stay in Hoi An with easy access to the Old Town area.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia ÄÃ¬nh Cozy Deluxe
review.comment_positive: My family and I had a great stay at the The Cozy. We booked for 3 nights. A beautiful boutique style hotel. Very clean rooms with lots of space and very comfy beds. The buffet breakfast was fantastic with a great range of both Asian and Western options. Beautiful views from the rooftop pool of the hinterland and sunsets. Also great to have bikes available to use. Very easy access to town with a 5 min walk getting you to the Old town area. We had a great stay here and highly recommend for travellers looking for a place just outside the hustle and bustle of the old town area but close enough to walk everywhere! Thank you to staff member Ling also who was a great help with places to visit etc. All the staff were fantastic and very welcoming!

review.comment_positive:
We loved our stay at the Cozy Savvy Hotel and made our trip to Hoi An very enjoyable despite heavy rain storms. The room was wonderfully decorated and the hotel had all the facilities we would wish for: Pool, Massage, in house laundry service and free bikes. Also the breakfast was great, it had western and vietnamese options and local fruits.
What really stood out though was the personal help and advice from Anne(Vi). She gave us so many helpful tips about restaurants, coffee places and tailoring. The kind interactions with her made us feel very well taken care of.
review.comment_negative: The room was sound proof, though noise from the hallway could be heard. A neighbor woke us up in the middle of the night by knocking loudly on their door for minutes.

The room was nice and comfortable.

review.rating: Our stay at this Hoi An hotel, highlighted by Anne's exceptional hospitality, outstanding amenities, and convenient
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive: Our stay at this hotel was unparalleled. Anne from the front office made us feel more welcomed than even in pricier 5-star hotels. The massage, pool, and breakfast exceeded expectations. Despite minor noise from housekeeping walkie-talkies, the rooms provided a quiet retreat. Though not directly in the city center, everything is conveniently within walking distance. If we return to Hoi An, there's no doubt we'll choose this hotel again.

review.comment_positive: Lovely staff, beautiful quaint boutique feel, can't fault this place. Great view of river, decent little gym and nice pool views. We loved our stay and nothing was too hard for the staff to assist with (Hannah was especially lovely). Hope to be back

Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive: We stayed at Cozy for 4 nights while we visited Hoi An. We loved our stay at the hotel. The staff were exceptional and we felt very welcomed with their customer centred care and guidance. We were taken back by the information and time given to us on our arrival from Cindy. She took the time to discuss with us what we wanted to do while in Hoi An the experiences we wanted to have. She provided us with a map and recommended local restaurants and costs for different tourist activities. The staff were very friendly everyday checking in on us and asking if they could improve our stay. Our Room was clean and beautifully decorated. We got our Laundry done on our arrival and it was collected and returned the next morning. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with many options to suit all food preferences - they hotel offered western coffee options too (cappuccino, latte ect.) We visited the gym a few times - though small, it had a treadmill, an exercise bike and one weight machine. We found it easy to access the path along the river from the hotel and were able to run/walk along their to the busy areas. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the main street of Tran Phu. The hotel offered free bikes to cycle around. We did not use them as we preferred to walk but they looked in good working order. The roof top pool was a good size with loungers at either end with under cover areas. The 360 degree view is great at sunset and sunrise. Highly recommend staying at Cozy if you are after exceptional service and care. Thankyou to all the Cozy staff for our stay, especially Cindy and Daisy who assisted us with our travel plans.

The facilities and hotel were clean and accommodating. Some highlights for us: the rooftop pool was nice and a great place to chill for some downtime; the breakfast had a lot of options and the dining area was super nice (indoor/outdoor seating on a quiet street); the room was clean and had a nice balcony.

The location is kind of perfect - it's on a quiet street with some restaurants and spas and is maybe a 8-10 min walk to the main quarters, So nice to be tucked away from the busy-ness of the main area.

The staff were also great. We ended up having to switch rooms because of an overwhelming lemongrass scent in our original room but the staff were super accommodating in this change. Throughout the stay, they checked-in to see how we were doing and always willing to help.

review.rating: Good family hotel, definitely recommend for short stay
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Our room was spacious, with a nice balcony. Comfortable bed.
Breakfast and even otherwise the restaurant was pretty good too! 
We faced a flooded Hoi An during our stay, and the staff really helped us by advising us correctly to stay indoors and even helped us move to their Da Nang hotel a day before when we expressed our interest to move to the city. This involved quite a few steps and we appreciate the support they offered. Thank you :)
On our last day we could finally use the bikes and they were such fun!!
review.comment_negative:
There weren't any facilities on the property that we could enjoy on the day we had to be indoors as the rest of Hoi An was nearly flooded. 
The gym was not operational and the spa being in the basement was also water logged. Although this is a situation that is in no one's control, what I mean is that - when you are forced to stay indoors, the property did not have anything to offer because everything is in basement and that was flooded.

review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
A Memorable Stay at Cosy Savvy Boutique Hotel in Hoi An
Review:
We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Cosy Savvy Boutique Hotel in Hoi An and were thoroughly impressed with every aspect of our experience. From the comfortable accommodation to the exceptional service and the delightful recommendations from Lyn, our stay was nothing short of outstanding.
The accommodation at Cosy Savvy Boutique Hotel was simply perfect. Our room was cozy, well-designed, and provided a relaxing atmosphere after a long day of exploring Hoi An. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful sleep every night. The attention to detail in the room's decor and amenities added an extra touch of luxury.
The service at this hotel was truly exceptional. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was unforgettable. Lyn, in particular, stood out with her warm and friendly nature. She welcomed us with a genuine smile and took the time to recommend the best places to dine in town. Her suggestions, including Morning Glory, Bale Well, Nu Eatery, and Ms V's Market, were spot-on and allowed us to savor the delicious local cuisine. Lyn also provided us with excellent recommendations for tailors, making our shopping experience in Hoi An even more enjoyable.
The overall service at Cosy Savvy Boutique Hotel deserves a five-star rating. Every staff member we encountered was attentive, polite, and eager to assist us with any requests or inquiries. The personalized attention and care we received made us feel truly valued as guests.
In terms of facilities, Cosy Savvy Boutique Hotel exceeded our expectations. The entire property was well-maintained, and the cleanliness was impeccable. The common areas, including the lobby and dining area, were inviting and tastefully decorated. The attention to detail in maintaining the cleanliness and freshness of the facilities contributed to the overall pleasant atmosphere of the hotel.

We can not thank Hannah and the rest of the staff at the hotel enough for making our stay so special.

ï¿¼John Rinaldi5/516 hours ago onÂ ï¿¼Â Google

A wonderful hotel in a wonderful city, l will aways have very fond memories of Hoi An and of this hotel, by far the best accommodation on our 4 week trip to Asia.
The hotel is positioned on the edge of the old town, so most things are within walking distance. The hotel has everything you could need, breakfast was very good as was the restaurant service available throughout the day. They made a special effort to cater for my partner's gluten intolerance.
The staff were friendly, approachable and respectful. This young team are a credit to the hotel, the polar opposite of the indifferent service we get in the UK. Vi in particular chatted with us daily to make sure everything was in order. Her courtesy and efficiency were outstanding.
review.comment_negative: The room had a slight damp smell to it, the hotel immediately provided a dehumidifier and citronella candle. The walls are very thin!

review.comment_positive: This is a gem of a hotel providing an oasis of peace, comfort and courteous service within walking distance of the town. We were greeted by Daisy with chilled cloths and tea. She then sat with us and chatted to find out what we might like to do. She provided a map of the town which she marked with places of interest for us. She regularly greeted us by name during our stay as did some other members of staff. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful and often asked how we were getting on.  The rooftop pool is gorgeous. Our room was fabulous and the breakfast was excellent with a large variety of choices. The hotel's decor was lovely. We would have liked to have been able to stay longer but had to move on due to previous arrangements. There is a very nice spa in the hotel which I used and was very happy with. There is also a gym available for use. I didn't use it so can't comment!

review.comment_positive: Ontvangst hartelijk met goede tips en tops van Hannah. Uitstekend personeel bij het ontbijt olv Emily, bediening bij het diner door Toean helemaal top en niet te vergeten, Daisy, Lin, Tracy, de trainees , de jongen die steeds zorgde dat wij op de fiets weg konden, de efficiente facilitaire ploeg en ieder die we vergeten te noemen. Kortom wij hebben het 8 dagen zeer naar ons zin gehad in het schone gezellige hotel. Airco werkt goed, Bedden kunnen iets zachter maar dat is persoonlijke smaak. Ontbijt is prima, vers, ruime keuze en als hoogtepunt: er wordt zeer goed rekening gehouden met een glutenvrij dieet. De ligging is prima voor bezoeken van de ancient city, markt,  koffie drinken in de straat bij King coffee,met de fiets in omgeving en rijstvelden touren en met een taxi ben je in nog geen tien minuten op het strand bij An Bang. review.comment_positive:
The hotel is located a short walk from the main area of old town. This was great for us as it was away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to reach. The hotel offers a free bike service to speed up the journey which we used everyday. You can also rent a scooter for 150k Dong + 30k dong for petrol. 

The property was very clean, the rooms were very nice and spacious. The hotel has a roof top pool which was great to chill at during the day. Food and drinks can be ordered to the pool. 

 The best part about the hotel was the service: The staff were attentive and very helpful with providing recommendations for coffee, restaurants and things to do. They were always there whenever you need them and can be reached from your room by a quick call.

review.comment_positive: Ideally located in a very quiet area, a few minutes walk away from the hustle and bustle of the old town. The Staff is simply amazing, very welcoming, professional and always smiling! Upon check-in Tracy gave us restaurants recommendations and useful tips to visit Hoi An and the countryside! The room is well equipped with a comfortable king size bed and a lovely balcony overlooking the river. The Breakfast is delicious and it has different choices of food, both Vietnamese and Western. The SPA is very clean and offer cheap and professional treatments.
review.comment_negative: If I have to be critical, I would suggest to add a shelf in the bathroom where you can place your beauty bags and I would also suggest to add a door to the walk-in shower so you donâ€™t get the floor wet when you take a shower. But these are minor things as our stay was excellent.

review.comment_positive:
From the minute we walked in we were welcomed with a warm greeting, a delicious welcome drink and the best staff. 

The room was amazing as I expected and the bed was so cozy. Breakfast in the morning is more than filling, the selection is beyond. 

We were there a few days before our wedding and the staff were incredible. They knew all the details and arranged so much for us. Their attention to detail and genuine care is really above and beyond. They treated my other guests just the same. I really worried about nothing during my time there. 

The location is perfect, east for others to stay close, a quick walk to old town but not so close that you hear the commotion. A beautiful window view to beat!

A big thanks to Anne and her team, wish we could have stayed longer!

review.rating: Beautiful hotel with great facilities, excellent location to old town in Hoi An, professional staff
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
This is our second stay in Hoi An. Cozy Savvy was delightful. The decor was beautiful, the rooms were comfortable (and had great light, nice balconies), the breakfast was fresh and delicious. The rooftop pool had wonderful views of the river and the sunset, and the hotel offered food/drink service there too, making it feel very luxurious. The location is good - with the free bike rentals from the hotel, we could bike into the Old Town within 5-10 minutes. There were a lot of clean spas nearby on the same street, where we felt comfortable getting foot massages after a long day of walking or biking. Check-in was smooth and professional. The hotel offers a shuttle to the beach, but we weren't able to try it out during our short stay. The hotel has a convenient location and excellent value, and it certainly felt like 4-star luxury. 

Another note: We were in town to take our friend around (for the first time to Hoi An) and to get some tailoring done in the Old town area. But unfortunately our friend had a medical emergency that had already started prior to check-in but then became much worse while we were checking-in - unrelated to the stay; in response, the hotel staff were professional and efficient about helping us locate a local medical clinic in Hoi An that was still open, and later, an ambulance to a large hospital in Da Nang. We are so glad and relieved that our friend could get medical attention quickly, and the hotel staff checked in with us regularly whenever we were in the lobby and in the restaurant (and they called our rooms promptly) during the emergency time and afterwards to update us and see how she was doing. We are very grateful to the staff's help during that scary time.
review.comment_negative: The street the hotel is on is also full of other hotels - some big ones and some cute small ones. As a result, it feels a little more touristy, but given it's location, that makes a lot of sense.

review.rating: Superb Stay and best Birthday surprise!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Best hotel I stayed in Hoi An, the room is superb and the staff were amazing and helpful. 
They even got a whole decent and delicious cake for my birthday which was served during breakfast and I was so surprised! I love this hotel and would highly recommend it to everyone who would stay in Hoi An.

The room, the furniture accents and details were great, the room is very aromatic and welcomes you with a relaxing smell. It's very clean as well and the view from the balcony is nice, make sure to request for a room facing the river as the other side isn't much but just a town view. The breakfast is also really good and lots of variety.

We also get to use the rooftop swimming pool and I recommend to catch the sunset from there as it was amazing! There's only few hotels that has rooftop pool/access. The location is a bit far as you have to take a cab or a shuttle because its towards the end of the road but the transport fee in Hoi an is cheap so its not much of an issue.

Would highly recommend this hotel if you want a relaxing and superb experience in the lovely town of Hoi An!

review.rating: Delicious breakfast, beautiful room and lovely staff
review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
We stayed 6 nights in Hoi An and this hotel was by far the best experience we had during our 3 week vacation in Vietnam.
I would like to highlight that the staff were exceptionally attentive and spoke very good English.
Ann gave us very tasty restaurant recommendations, Daisy clarified several issues regarding Get Your Guide bookings for us and Chris was our morning sunshine and surprised my partner with a small birthday cake during breakfast. 
The beds are very comfortable, the water pressure was good and the best part was the phenomenal breakfast buffet which varied every morning. Kudos to the staff in the kitchen, you guys do a great job!
We also enjoyed the pool area as the hotel location is central but still in a quiet street. The decoration is tasteful and unique, we liked the lamps and â€antiqueâ€œ tiles.
We would recommend to stay at Cozy Savvy Boutique to anyone. We liked the breakfast much better than in other 5 star hotels weâ€™ve been here.

review.comment_positive: Wow where can I start? From the moment we arrived we made to feel at home by the staff. From the welcome drink after a long day travelling to fantastic recommendations for restaurants and coffee shops, along with a tailor (thanks V, Minh and Kathy at reception) we felt taken care of. The room featured a very comfortable king size bed, balcony, shower and bath. The hotel is situated on a quiet street of Hoi An but easy to walk to see all the sights in town. Special shout out to Kathy at the reception who went above and beyond to help us with getting our final fitting of our clothes. We cannot thank her enough for helping to arrange this when we had checked out two days earlier! Would stay again in a heart beat.

review.comment_positive: Great little hotel within walkable distance of the old town but in a quieter area. The staff are wonderful and regularly ask if everything is ok with your stay. They are also very helpful in planning trips and others things to do around Hoi An. On the roof there is a small pool which is fine for a quick dip after a day sightseeing and also a nice spot to grab a beer or cocktail. There is also a small gym and a spa in the basement but didnt try these. Breakfast was great with lots of fresh fruit,pastries, egg station and daily local specialities. Really could not fault the place for the price

review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng
review.comment_positive: We had a fantastic stay at Cozy Savy. The staff were amazing especially Hannah and Lin who went above and beyond to make us feel special from the welcoming check-in and throughout the stay. The breakfast was great. We had different options every day which included Vietnamese, Continental and English, plus they had an egg chef. We enjoyed the pool happy hour from 2.00pm until 4.30pm when it was too hot to be in the town. There were not lots of pool beds but there were always enough when we were there. The free bikes were good and there seemed plenty available. It was about a 15 minute walk into the Old Town or 5 minutes on the bikes. We liked our room and the view. Overall the vibe in the hotel was relaxed and the staff made us feel valued, important and cared for.

review.rating: Luxury home base for exploring Hoi An City.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Vee, my concierge and host was incredibly thoughtful and thorough at the checkin process, and made sure I knew all of the best places to visit while staying in Hoi An. My room had stunning views of the river and the city and it felt like something out of a movie (601 if you can get it).

The rooftop pool was great, the breakfast was one of the better included breakfasts of any I've had, with a variety of eastern and western cuisine, fresh egg station and a pho option.

The gym downstairs is a single cable machine and bench setup. You can do a pretty solid workout there but sometimes it feels like the whole thing might just fall apart mid rep.

The bikes out front were key for exploring the town at the proper pace, Hoi An is set up for cycling and walking so take advantage of it.

review.comment_positive:
Cosy Savvy Hotel with Ms. Kathy and team was exceptional and great value for money. I will recommend to all friends thinking to come to Hoi An. Our stay was faultless. The bedroom is smart, with a beautiful bathroom. The pool is clean and of a very good size, with sun beds and a covered soft seating area.  Breakfast is very generous with many options of Vietnamese, local Hoi An delicacies, fruit, eggs, Croissants, toast, bacon and more. We wish we could have stayed longer. A comfortable 10 minute walk into the old town.

The best hotel we have stayed at in Vietnam so far in 10 days.

review.comment_negative: Soundproofing. We were given a connecting room. We should've asked to change it the minute we check-in but thought it'll be alright. It was alright the first night, then came noisy, loud neighbor. It was made worst when the neighboring guests abuse the hotel's trusting policy (minimal to no security staffs) by bringing back "special guests" in the middle of the night (3am-4am!) & created all sorts of unwanted "adult-fun" noise. At first we thought it was a couple staying next door so we didn't complain. When it happened again on our final night there we knew it was "special guest" they had sneaked into the hotel. We informed the hotel. We hope the hotel increase measures on security to eliminate this kind of unwanted disturbance. Especially it seems lots of family with young kids stay at this hotel.

review.comment_positive:
Amazing location, situated on the edge of the Old Town. The check-in process was a particular highlight as the staff discuss local attractions, food, shopping and tips while marking on a map for you. You get served delicious biscuits and tea upon arrival as well. They encourage you to nominate interests so they can customise their guidance and advice. Also, we were blown away by the fact that the attendants remember your name, a very nice personal touch.

The room furnishings are traditional and ornate vintage, making the stay feel even more genuine and unique. The staff explained that they purposefully ensured the room furnishings and fittings capture traditional Vietnamese aesthetics and it has achieved that in spades. Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again!

review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cove Savvy - Sunset Cove
review.comment_positive:
Our stay in this hotel was wonderful. The room was very nice. The bed is comfy and the furniture is so nice looking. We loved the style of the room and of the building in general. Everything has a perfect Vietnamese and Hoi An style. There is really a big attention to details. It is a real boutique hotel. 
The breakfast is good quality and there is a big choice of food. One day we did a trip leaving early morning and the staff prepared for us a â€œTaylor madeâ€ breakfast take away. 
The position is good because is just 10 mi a walking from the central bridge but it is not in the growled streets with music and the market. It can be easily reached with Grab or Taxy. 
The staff is always at your disposal. Hanna and her colleagues helped us with a lot of suggestions about restaurants, place to visit, where to go shopping and so on. They also helped with taxy and they are available to help you organize day trip around the city. I would say that the staff is really the â€œplusâ€ of this hotel. 
One of the days of our stay it was the birthday of my boyfriend. The staff organized for me a surprise breakfast at the pool located on the top of the building. They were really helpful on this and they also bring a surprise birthday cake to us. This will be really a good memory for us. 
In conclusion I recommend you to stay at this hotel because the price is really good but the stay and the staff even more! It worth it!

review.rating: A perfect option to stay in Hoi An
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
This hotel is fantastic and for the price it is a steal - we loved it and would go back if we go back to Hoi An! The rooms look just like in the pictures, with beautiful decor, large comfortable beds, they are spotlessly clean with a nice smell (which is not a given in Hoi An) and the wifi works well (I can confirm since we watched a whole World Cup match on streaming :)). The staff is extremely nice and helpful and they made a nice romantic display for us with rose petals when we arrived.  We got a couples vietnamese body massage in the spa, so affordable (12 euros for a 1h massage!) and wonderful - we highly recommend that you try it! 
They also have free bikes to borrow which is a nice touch to get to the old town or visit the surrounding rice fields.
review.comment_negative:
Perhaps there are two details to mention: 
- The breakfast could have more Western options available; currently the hot dishes (with exception of the egg station) are meals that we would not eat for breakfast such as beef, stew, pasta, etc. However, we stayed in 3 hotels in Vietnam and they all had the exact same breakfast, so this is probably not a limitation of this hotel but of many.
- The location is not right next to the old town of Hoi An (where you will likely spend most of your visit), it is about 15 minutes walking from it through a local street. So we would rate the location 8/10. But still convenient and probably much quieter than staying right in the center.

review.comment_positive: The staff went above and beyond to make sure we had good service. For example, I found a mistake on the menu, and the manager had them all reprinted by the morning and came over to the table to thank us personally. The massages were so nice we got them twice :). Cindy also spent 20 minutes showing us on the maps which places to go they. And the breakfast buffet was excellent! Beautiful central location that is 5-10 min walk from ancient town and all the lively streets, but quiet place to stay as itâ€™s a few blocks away. Hotel has beautiful flowers and lanterns, and the pool on the roof is great as well!
review.comment_negative: The only 2 small things I can think of, which both happen to be food related are: that the noodles on my cau Lao were stale, tough and chewy, rather than crispy. And the salad that came with their stake could be better as it was just 1 piece of lettuce, 2 slices of tomato, and a slice of onion with no dressing (more like the toppings ready to put on a burger). But other than that I would say their food and service was very good! Best breakfast I had during my trip.

review.rating: Excellent hotel, perfect location, amazing staff. We will be back!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
The Cozy Boutique Hotel is fantastic. 
The location is excellent; close to everything at the end of a quiet street, lots of restaurants close by, easy walk into old town, and peaceful nights so you can sleep. 
The room is wonderful; very comfortable beds, lovely river view, big bathroom, cold fridge, clean great sized room, and lots of hot water. 
The breakfast is fabulous; freshly made eggs, a selection of other delicious breakfast foods, hot and cold beverages, fresh fruit galore, and a lovely large, bright restaurant to eat in. 
The staff here is the best part, even after all the other wonderful things about this hotel. They pride themselves on taking excellent care of the customers and it shows. From the moment you walk in the door the front desk staff envelop you in their Hoi An charm and make sure every second of your stay is perfect. Miss Vy was the reason we had such an amazing stay at this hotel, making wonderful suggestions on where to eat, where to go and what to see. Everything she arranged or suggested for us was perfect! She is the star of the show at the front desk and her colleagues are just as wonderful. Miss Ling is another staff member who is a rising star at this hotel and will make sure you are well taken care of. Miss Emily in the restaurant is hilarious and awesome. You will not go hungry or thirsty or want for anything while she's working, she is on top of everything. 
Honestly, the staff are remarkable and made our stay one of the best experiences we've ever had.

review.room_type: Suite Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng

review.comment_positive:
El hotel cumpliÃ³ con todas nuestras expectativas. Las habitaciones son muy bonitas y nuevas. La piscina en la terraza del hotel estaba genial y todo el hotel es muy agradable. La ubicaciÃ³n tambiÃ©n muy buena, puedes ir andado al centro histÃ³rico, pero estÃ¡s a un par de calles de donde empieza el bullicio y por tanto es bastante tranquilo. El desayuno tambiÃ©n nos gustÃ³.
La ciudad de Hoi An es muy bonita, seguramente la mÃ¡s bonita de Vietnam, y por la noche con las barquitas en el canal y los farolillos por todas las calles, estÃ¡ realmente de cuento.
review.comment_negative:
Llegamos a una hora en la que todavÃ­a no estaban listas las habitaciones, ya que el check in en este hotel se hace bastante tarde, y a la que ya estaban a punto de cerrar los restaurantes de los alrededores. Lo que nosotros querÃ­amos en ese momento era poder ir rÃ¡pido a comer, y asÃ­ se lo dijimos a la chica que nos hizo el chek in, pero ella se pasÃ³ de amable y estuvo como 15-20 minutos dÃ¡ndonos explicaciones y consejos sobre quÃ© visitar en la ciudad,. Por cortesÃ­a no nos atrevimos a cortarla y casi nos quedamos sin poder comer en el restaurante al que querÃ­amos ir. Se agradecen las explicaciones, pero deberÃ­an darse cuenta de cual es la prioridad del cliente en cada momento. :-)
A la maÃ±ana siguiente me prestaron una bici para recorrer la ciudad, pero los frenos no funcionaban bien y no me di cuenta hasta que me habÃ­a alejado bastante del hotel.

review.comment_negative:
the staff was super nosy, asking too many questions like â€œwhere are you going?â€ â€œdo you know how to go there?â€ etc. the questions were really beyond being just polite and at some point it was so annoying that we were hiding from the staff. 
i would wish for more space as a guest cause if i donâ€™t know how to go somewhere i would ask. 
also we had our laundry done and after we came back all of our clothes were hung into the closet; which we found also a bit invading. we would have preferred that they just told us the laundry is ready and we can pick it up at the reception.

so generally: give the guest more space!!

review.rating: Very modern and friendly small hotel
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia ÄÃ¬nh Cozy Deluxe
review.comment_positive:
This hotel has lovely spacious rooms that were nicely decorated. My friend and I booked the family room and we basically got two separate rooms with our own bathrooms and just an interconnecting door. 

Breakfast was very good and the staff were super friendly and helpful. When we arrived we were greeted with some tea and biscuits and Lyn sat down with us and gave us a map of Hoi An and lots of good recommendations for things to see, do and eat. 

The hotel is about a km from the old town but there are plenty of free bicycles available to borrow. We even used those to get ourselves to the beach one day. 

We also used the massage service (they had a two for one deal in the afternoon) and the laundry service was reasonably priced as well (by the kg not per item).

review.comment_positive:
The staff was simply delightful and offered so much help in everything from booking tours to car service to just offering tips to get to know Hoi An. The room was excellent, so clean, airy, well-lit and comfortable. The breakfast had everything you could ever want and more, the pool area was a treat to relax in, and the spa services were so nice! 

We loved everything about Cozy, but above all the staff made us feel so taken care of and the location was unbeatable -- right outside the old town, which offers a bit of relaxation away from the fun chaos, but still close enough to everywhere you want to go.

review.comment_positive:
The room was beautiful, bright, spacious and felt luxurious. The air con was great and cooled down quickly when we needed to get away from the heat

The staff were exceptional. Cindy in particular helped us out massively, marking out all of the best restaurants, lantern making classes, tailors, night markets etc on a map. She also helped us organise a My Son sanctuary tour at a reasonable price. 

The breakfasts were varied and incredibly tasty. They incorporated a lot of local and national dishes that we had already intended to try during our visit, so that was great! 

We can't say much more than our family (2 adults + 1 two year old) stay was perfect!

review.rating: Beautiful, comfortable and well located hotel in Hoi An
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia ÄÃ¬nh Cozy Deluxe
review.comment_positive: Our stay at the Cozy Savvy Boutique Hotel was amazing. We had two had two adjoining rooms for our family of 4 and they were both large, luxurious and spotlessly clean. The bathrooms were huge and very well appointed. The buffet breakfast had decent variety and our kids loved it. We also heavily utilised the rooftop pool area which was a great space to chill out and order some drinks and snacks after a day of sightseeing. The location of the hotel is very convenient with only a short walk into the old town, yet in a relatively quiet street. Last but not least the staff were lovely, attentive and super helpful; particularly Zoe and Anne who assisted us many times during our stay. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hoi An.

review.rating: Best hotel in Vietnam and value for money!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe áº¤m CÃºng NhÃ¬n Ra Thá»‹ Tráº¥n
review.comment_positive:
Everything was great! The welcoming, that made us feel really welcomed, the important information reception gave us concerning some tours, the receptionist's patience to answer all our questions and the calls she made to resolve our matters with local tour operators, the spacious rooms, the great breakfast, the location, the friendliness of the staff...everything! Totally worth it and recommended! I would love to stay here again!

Rooms were spacious and the bathroom had an autonomy, ie in every other place we visited in Vietnam and Cambodia rooms were somehow small, there was not enough space for our stuff as international visitors with big luggage and the doors of the bathrooms were either from glass (?!?!) or with openings at the bottom of the doors?! Here the greatest asset was the comfortable beds, the space in the room, so that we could move with no restrictions and open our luggage easily and the bathroom was big, well equiped, with a shower WITH a glass, so that everything does not get wet! 

The staff was very kind, very attentive, very helpful and speaking excellent english!

We didn't try the breakfast, but our friends that did mentioned the great variety and that everything was very tasty and well made!
review.comment_negative: Nothing, everything was great!

One of the best hotels we enjoyed in Vietnam

review.comment_positive: el hotel estÃ¡ genial, la arquitectura del edificio en la misma lÃ­nea de la ciudad, con madera de teca, farolillos, etc. el personal es muy atento y amable, en especial Tracy, fue muy atenta y amable con nosotros desde el momento de la bienvenida aÃºn con la barrera del idioma (no hablamos mucho inglÃ©s), se esforzÃ³ mucho para que nos pudiÃ©ramos comunicar, estando tan lejos de tu paÃ­s es una maravilla que alguien asÃ­ te cuide y se preocupe por tus necesidades en cada momento. el desayuno estÃ¡ bien, tienes de todo, la fruta sobre todo es buena, la piscina no es muy grande pero con ideal para refrescarte (en Hoi An hace calor) y nadar un poco, tienes vistas al rÃ­o, nos dimos unos masajes en el spa del hotel y los precios son muy asequibles, el trato de las chicas del spa es inmejorable y el masaje perfecto. en el hotel te dejan unas bicis, que para visitar la zona de arrozales de los alrededores estÃ¡ muy bien, de este modo ves la zona no turÃ­stica y cÃ³mo viven en zonas mÃ¡s rurales, este servicio (bicicletas) es gratuito. en resumen el hotel es de 10, tanto los empleados, como la habitaciÃ³n, instalaciones, desayuno, etc. sin duda repetirÃ­a de nuevo y lo recomendarÃ­a., ademÃ¡s la ubicaciÃ³n estÃ¡ muy bien, lejos del ruido pero cerca andando del centro, no se tarda nada.

review.room_type: Biá»‡t Thá»± Cozy Savvy - Morning Glory
review.comment_positive: We stayed 8 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. Breakfasts were delicious with a wide, mixed and varied selection of Vietnamese dishes (noodle soups and eggs a favourite), European options, fruit, cereals, you name it. Great restaurant staff and food constantly replenished. Room was so good, housekeeping thorough and very regular. Spacious lounge areas and lots of nice spaces and beautifully kept gardens. Two attractive pools (one on the roof top with fab views). Reception staff really top notch. Immediate response to any questions. Also, that indefinable quality of friendly, caring yet professional staffing at all levels. Lovely location outside the tourist madness of the old town yet only 5/10 minutes to walk into it to sample it and then escape back to the sanctuary of the hotel. Highly recommend.
